solution:
The $\text{70's}$ stamps cost:

$\bullet$  Brazil, $12(\$ 0.06) = \$ 0.72;$

$\bullet$  Peru, $6(\$ 0.04) = \$ 0.24;$

$\bullet$  France, $12(\$ 0.06) = \$ 0.72;$

$\bullet$  Spain, $13(\$ 0.05) = \$ 0.65.$

The total is $\$2.33$ for the $43$ stamps and the average price is $\frac{\$ 2.33}{43} \approx \$0.054 = \boxed{5.4 \text{ cents}}.$
model_solution:
The total number of stamps from the $70\text{'s}$ can be found by adding $12+12+6+13$.
Add the total number of stamps from the $70\text{'s}$, $12 + 12 + 6 + 13 = 43$.
The total price of the $70\text{'s}$ stamps is $12\left(4\right)+12\left(4\right)+6\left(4\right)+13\left(5\right)$.
Evaluate the total price of the $70\text{'s}$ stamps: $12\left(4\right)+12\left(4\right)+6\left(4\right)+13\left(5\right)$ = $48 + 48 + 24 + 65 = 185$ cents.
The average price of the 70's stamps is $\frac{185}{43}$ cents.
Evaluate $\frac{185}{43}$ to the nearest tenth of a cent.
